update.description:
Implemented a method for getting fork-like running on windows (it can not work with functions, just running binaries). The full thing should compile, although runtime problems still exists.

* [drone is happy](https://drone.io/bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-transport/198) on Linux.
* [jenkins is not so happy, but compilation is fine](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_transport-any-devel-windows7-i386/76/console) on Windows.

Update: merged with default in 9effa61

* [drone is happy](https://drone.io/bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-transport/233) on Linux.
* [windows jenkins job](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_transport-any-devel-windows7-i386/80/console): compilation passes with warning; some tests are failing.
* [mac jenkins job](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/ignition_transport/job/ignition_transport-any-devel-homebrew-amd64/17/): compilation is fine with no warnings; it says all tests passed, though the console output seems to indicate that one test failed.

Update 99d4d64:

* [drone is happy](https://drone.io/bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-transport/246)
* [windows is improving](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_transport-any-devel-windows7-i386/82/consoleFull): 19% tests passed, 21 tests failed out of 26
* [homebrew is happy](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/ignition_transport/job/ignition_transport-any-devel-homebrew-amd64/19/)
* Yes, there is a problem in one of the tests. issue #21.
update.title: Windows: compile tests and examples (take II)

content.raw:
This is interesting, we should check how the real network interface is handling the virtual docker network interfaces. We probably won't accomplish a full testing level between systems (thinking on the networking layer) but it could help. Good idea.

As a side note: they are recently starting to support windows.
content.html:
This is interesting, we should check how the real network interface is handling the virtual docker network interfaces. We probably won't accomplish a full testing level between systems (thinking on the networking layer) but it could help. Good idea.

As a side note: they are recently starting to support windows.

content.html:
I just made a few minor comments. I think it's out of the scope of this pull request but we should think a better way of running custom tests. There are several cases to test that involve the creation of a variety of publishers/subscribers and we need a generic way to spawn publishers and subscribers that scales better. There are tests that publish several messages, unsubscribe, etc. It would be nice to have a "scriptable" way of designing a test scenario. Something like:

  • I need a publisher on topic /foo with scope x that publishes one message, after 100ms. publishes another one, after 200ms. another one, and then, unadvertise the topic and terminate. Then, you can run your test that verifies a particular feature. Maybe we could specify the 'test environment' that we want in a text/yaml file. How about something like this?
TEST(myTest)
{
  // Run auxiliary nodes that advertise, publish, subscribe.
  prepareEnvironment(myCustomScenario1.yaml);

  // Verify a particular feature given the current scenario.
  ...
}
